subject: Greetings Dear Beneficiary!
body:
Greetings Dear Beneficiary!
I am Binta Ndoye Touré and Chief Executive Officer of Orabank Benin Republic.
It is with good spirit of heart I opened up this great opportunity to you. Your overdue payment of  10,500,000.00 (US$10.5M) have been approved by BCEAO | Banque Centrale des Etats de l'Afrique de l'Ouest (Central Bank of West African States) The meeting held with the bank Executives and his Excellency, President Patrice Talon in Paris-France.
Therefore, your payment file have been posted to Madrid-Spain due to your payment allocation region and you are granted to visit them for the collection of your fund in person and also to enable you sign some back-up documents.
Kindly get back to me for more details and your complete information as well as a scan copy of identity card of yours for identification!.
Enclosed mail attachment is a scan copy of your identity for your perspective record.
Forward all your complete information as was requested to my private E-Mail contact Address below ( 
ndoyebtoure@gmail.com
 )
Yours sincerely
Binta Ndoye Touré
Rue du Gouverneur Général Ponty
E-Mail Address ( 
ndoyebtoure@gmail.com
 )
01 BP 2700 Cotonou
Tel: (+229) 64 60 34 55/ (+229) 96 74 81 11
Fax: 00(+229) 21 21 01 01

subject: Re:   Greetings Dear Beneficiary!
body:
Hello Binta Ndoye Tour,

Thank you for reaching out to me. It's a pleasure to hear from you. I'm intrigued by the information you've shared about the overdue payment and the involvement of BCEAO Banque Centrale des Etats de l'Afrique de l'Ouest.

Could you please provide more details about this situation? For instance, how did this payment come to be overdue? And what kind of documents would I need to sign?

I appreciate your time and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
William
